text: Get ready for some overlooked Jeremy Soule goodness. Everquest Next was famously cancelled and they somehow decided it was a good idea to release the game's player content creation tool under Landmark, which completely failed and shut down after only 6 months. The biggest letdown for me was that Jeremy Soule's music went down with it before anyone really discovered how great it was. A truly underrated soundtrack by a well known and amazing musician. This theme is magical.
author: SupraDarky

text: When I first heard there was a new Everquest, I was stoked. Then it was cancelled.... then you post this and got all excited again "OMG! They are really going to release it?!" Nope... you tease
author: Gorilla Games

text: What's your favourite track of his from Skyrim? I like 'Ancient Stones'.
author: Green

text:
I was super bummed when I heard Jeremy Soule wasn't going to be the composer for the Guild Wars 2's 2015 expansion, Heart of Thorns, because he was contracted for the Everquest Next project. Maclaine Diemer and Lena Chappelle, who replaced Soule, did an amazing job tho!

This sounds lovely, I'll have to check out of rest.
author: allthatishere

text: @Green "The Streets of Whiterun" stole my heart a long time ago. It gives me such a nostalgic feeling. It makes me feel like I'm home.
author: allthatishere

text: My boi been at it for 11 years! Bravo! You are truly dedicated to your masterpiece
author: VirtuosoFabi

text: Wait, are you saying this was never really used for anything? They can't just take this and use it in another game?
author: altshiftk

text: I'm sure the cost of keeping servers going was too high but I wish they had just let Landmark stay open as a sandbox building game like minecraft. Let people host their own servers or something, the level of detail in builds was insane.
author: GrampappyJoe

text: Never even heard of this game, but this song is incredible. Best video game music ive heard in months
author: Commander Shepard

text: So soothing! Sound like an epic fantasy adventure which I wish I'd listen more

text: Jeremy Soule really knows how to compose usic that makes your heart swell...
